page.title: 09Shiskine/B'waterfoot Garage
page.content: There are ten lorries at Bannatyne's Four go to the mainland three times a week. The lorries can carry up to twenty tons. The lorries bring fertiliser, animal feed, building material, spirits, food for the Co-op and coal from the mainland. The lorries take cheese, livestock and cobbles to the mainland. They go to England only on special furniture removals. There are six lorries which stay on the island. There are four mechanics who work at the garage. They service other people's cars as well as their own. In the winter they sell about 700gallons of petrol a week and in the summer 1200-1800 depending on the tourists. They always have cars available to rent. There are 18 people working at the garage. They have 7 different kinds of lorries. It costs Â£4000 a month for ferry charges.
